content.rendered:
Who are We?

Silver Homes Old Age Home is an elderly care and support facility established in Pune for the needy elderly. The main goal of the Senior Center is to take care of them and support them with compassion, empathy, and kindness. We specialize in caring for people in need and daily support. Silver Homes provides lasting security and care to loved ones, provides protection from intruders and helps you lead a safe life. For joining us please contact us.

Neither giving nor receiving care is easy. Silver Homes Senior Care adds relationships first to support those giving care, to protect the dignity of those receiving it, and to enhance the quality of life for both seniors and their families.

Silver Homes Senior Care Center offers affordable care services 24 hours a day, 365 days a year for those who need it.

At Silver Homes Pune, we provide high-quality, person-centered care that enables residents to live meaningful lives. We cater to each individual’s preferences and respect their choices throughout the continuum of care.

What we have to Offer

  1. Old Age Care
  2. Dementia Care
  3. Care for Bedridden
  4. Day Care Services
  5. Assisted Living
  6. Post Operative Care

Stay Options:-

  1. Long Stay
  2. Short Stay
  3. Day Stay

Continuing the Legacy

As one grows older, it is necessary to have love, respect, and grace. Similarly, the genuine test of the younger generation may be in returning the love and care that our parents and elders have bestowed on us with similar dignity and care. This thought inspired our founders and team members from all walks of life to get together and create the Silver Homes concept.

Late Dr. H.N. Phadnis

Dr. H. N. Phadnis founded Shree Clinic, a small 7-bed hospital in 1956. Dr. Phadnis was a teacher at the BJ Medical College, when he took the unprecedented step of seeking a loan to start a clinic!

The small clinic grew to a 20-bed nursing home in the leafy by-lanes of Jungli Maharaj Road and became a sanctuary for expectant mothers at a time when dedicated woman-and-child care was still largely a cottage industry. A much loved and charismatic doctor, with a larger-than-life persona, Dr. Phadnis ran Shree Clinic with the help of his wife Sumati and sister Radha, both of whom provided the extremely compassionate, personal nursing care that became the hallmark of the clinic. While Dr. Phadnis himself went on to pursue a spiritual path at the very peak of his career, he had laid the foundation for a legacy that would continue undaunted into the future. ONP Hospital traces its origins back to this clinic.

EXPLORE OUR FACILITIES

Late Mrs. Sumati Phadnis

Late Mrs. Sumati Phadnis was a retired nurse. She trained at a nursing college in the 40s at a time when very few women were doing nursing. She was a nurse par excellence and provided excellent support to the doctors and caring and compassionate professional care to the patients. She worked tirelessly as a nurse for a span of four decades before she retired. She continued to guide new nurses at Oyster and Pearl Hospital, Pune.
